ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned the skills of memorization and then using the memorized information and actually applying it to the language.
I expanded my grammar knowledge, became a better speaker, and learned a little bit of Italian history and culture
Basic Italian grammar skills, improved Italian conversation skills, how to answer basic questions, improved composition skills
I became much better at both speaking and understanding Italian grammatically.
Learn how to speak read and write Italian.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Would have helped to go over the grammar more frequently in class.

Strengths: I enjoyed the "serious fun" model. Having real conversations and answering real questions in Italian was very helpful to improve fluency. It helps you start thinking in Italian. Feedback was always helpful and considerate. Instead of discouraging me, it helped me learn. The pace was much better than L1. Weaknesses: It is easy to forget material- especially specific grammar concepts and vocabulry. More practice spaced throughout the semester might be useful.

I enjoyed the discussions before class, I think it brought the class together while also improving our speaking abilities. I also liked the speed at which we learned the material. L1 was a little too quick to fully understand the material before we were tested, but this semester I felt like i had time to grasp it fully.
Teacher was incredible and very encouraging. Improved a lot in dialogue skills.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, the Italian department is amazing.
Yes, I would. Learning Italian in L2 has honestly been very fun, and I enjoy being able to express myself in another language!
Would definitely recommend this course. Not boring, although sometimes a little slow pace. Not hard to get a good grade in either. Definitely take with Kyle who is an incredible teacher.
Yes! I really enjoyed this class.
Yes, Italian is a great language. Teachers are relaxed and good.
Yes, Kyle is a great teacher and I really enjoyed going to class.
